A: You can use the postDelayed() method of the Handler class to delay the execution of a code snippet. In your case, you want to change the visibility of a TextView after a button is clicked. Here's how you can do it:

```java
button.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener() {
    @Override
    public void onClick(View v) {
        textView.setVisibility(View.VISIBLE);
        new Handler().postDelayed(new Runnable() {
            @Override
            public void run() {
                textView.setVisibility(View.GONE);
            }
        }, 7000);
    }
});
```

In this code, when the button is clicked, the TextView's visibility is set to VISIBLE. Then, after 7000 milliseconds (or 7 seconds), the TextView's visibility is set to GONE.

Please replace `button` and `textView` with your actual button and text view ids.

This code should be placed in the onCreate() method of your activity. If you're using fragments, you should place it in the onViewCreated() method.
